questions.question:
Please assume $$\Delta$$ to represebt the symmetric difference between sets, for the entire test, unless stated otherwise. 
Let $$X = \{1,2,3,\dots,10\}$$ and $$P = \{1,2,3,4,5\}$$. 
The number of subsets $$Q$$ of $$X$$ such that $$P \Delta Q = \{3\}$$ is:

For each positive integer $$n$$ consider the set $$P_n = \{1,2,3,\dots,n\}$$. 
Let $$Q_1 = P_1$$, $$Q_2 = P_2 \Delta Q_1 = \{2\}$$, and in general 
$$Q_{n+1} = P_{n+1} \Delta Q_n$$ for $$n \ge 1$$. 
Then the number of elements in $$Q_{2k}$$ is:

For any two sets $$S,T$$, $$S \Delta T = (S \cup T) - (S \cap T)$$. 
Let $$A,B,C$$ satisfy $$A \cap B \cap C = \varnothing$$, and each of 
$$A \Delta B$$, $$B \Delta C$$, $$C \Delta A$$ has $$100$$ elements. 
Then $$|A \cup B \cup C|$$ equals:
Let $$A,B,C,D$$ be finite sets with $$|A| < |C|$$ and $$|B| = |D|$$. Then:
options: $$|A \cup B| \le |C \cup D|$$ but $$|A \cup B| < |C \cup D|$$ need not always hold
$$|A \cup B| < 2|C \cup D|$$ but $$|A \cup B| \le |C \cup D|$$ need not always hold
none of the foregoing is true

questions.question:
For subsets $$A,B$$ of $$X$$, define 
$$A * B = (A \cap B) \cup ((X-A) \cap (X-B))$$. 
Only one of the following is true:

Suppose $$A,B,C$$ satisfy 
$$(A-B) \Delta (B-C) = A \Delta B$$. 
Which must be true?
If $$L_1 = \{\alpha^n : n \ge 0\}$$ and $$L_2 = \{\beta^n : n \ge 0\}$$, then $$L_1 L_2$$ equals:

Suppose $$L$$ contains the empty word and has: if $$P \in L$$, then $$\alpha P \beta \in L$$. 
The smallest such $$L$$ is:

Suppose $$L$$ contains empty, $$\alpha$$, $$\beta$$, and whenever $$P,Q \in L$$ then $$PQ \in L$$. 
The smallest such $$L$$ is:

Define $$(x,y) \leftarrow (z,w)$$ if $$x<z$$ or ($$x=z$$ and $$y>w$$). 
If $$(x,y) \leftarrow (z,w)$$ and $$(z,w) \leftarrow (r,s)$$, which is always true?

Let $$S = \{m/2^n : m,n \in \mathbb{Z}\}$$ and 
$$T = \{p/q : p,q \in \mathbb{Z},\ q\ \text{odd}\}$$. 
Which is true?
options: S is a ring, T is not
T is a ring, S is not
both S and T are rings

questions.question:
For real $$a,b$$, define $$a^+ = \max(a,0)$$. 
Then $$(ab)^+ = a^+ b^+$$ iff:
For reals $$x,y,z$$, only one is correct:
options: $$\langle x+y+z \rangle = \langle x+y \rangle + \langle y+z \rangle + \langle z+x \rangle - \langle x \rangle - \langle y \rangle - \langle z \rangle$$

questions.question:
Let $$x_i = -x_{n-i+1}$$. 
Consider $$S = \sum_{i<j<k} x_i x_j x_k$$. Then $$S$$ equals:
Let $$x = \sup A$$, $$y = \sup B$$, and $$C = A+B$$. If $$z = \sup C$$, then:

Out of $$100$$ students: $$50$$ failed Math, $$45$$ Physics, $$40$$ Statistics; $$32$$ failed exactly two; $$1$$ passed all. 
Number failing all?

100 families read: IT $$42$$, Sun $$30$$, ND $$28$$; intersections: IT∩Sun $$10$$, IT∩ND $$8$$, Sun∩ND $$8$$, all $$3$$ = $$3$$. 
Number reading none?
Same survey: number reading either both or none of Sunday & India Today?

A club with $$x$$ members has $$4$$ committees. 
Each member is in exactly $$2$$ committees; each pair of committees shares exactly one member. Then:

120 persons: Bengalis $$80$$, Gujaratis $$40$$; Muslims $$70$$, Hindus $$50$$. 
# Bengali Muslims?

Football team plays $$60$$ games; never loses $$3$$ in a row; never wins $$5$$ in a row. 
If $$N$$ is number of wins, then:

Box has $$100$$ balls: R$$28$$, B$$17$$, G$$21$$, W$$10$$, Y$$12$$, Bl$$12$$. 
Smallest $$n$$ such that any $$n$$ balls guarantee $$\ge 15$$ of some colour?

Positive $$x,y,z,w$$ satisfy: 
(i) $$x>y \Rightarrow z>w$$; 
(ii) $$x>z \Rightarrow y<w$$. 
Which statement is valid?
